0.question:
Ken moved into a new apartment. It was near a busy street. The sounds kept Ken up most nights. He decided to buy some ear plugs. Ken was more easily able to sleep.
Which is more likely?
(a) Ken would likely continue using ear plugs to help him sleep.
(b) Ken would likely continue using ear plugs to help him sleep so that he could match them with his pajamas.
0.target_answer: Ken would likely continue using ear plugs to help him sleep.

1.question:
I wanted to buy headphones. So I settled for something cheap. The headphones didn't have a comfortable fit. And they didn't sound as good as I thought they would. I decided to always save up instead.
Which is more likely?
(a) The protagonist would save up to buy better quality headphones next time.
(b) The protagonist would save up to buy better quality headphones next time so that he could potentially use them as a makeshift phone holder.
1.target_answer: The protagonist would save up to buy better quality headphones next time.

2.question:
Tom moved out to the coast. He experienced his first earthquake. It was a minor one. Tom freaked out. His friends made fun of him.
Which is more likely?
(a) Tom would research how to prepare for earthquakes.
(b) Tom would research how to prepare for earthquakes so that he could try out a new recipe for dinner.
2.target_answer: Tom would research how to prepare for earthquakes.

3.question:
My husband and I wanted to have a baby. We spent a few months trying, then got pregnant. Pregnancy was rough, as I was very sick. Then after 9 months, I knew labor was starting. After 10 hours at the hospital, we had our new baby!
Which is more likely?
(a) The protagonist would cherish and care for their new baby.
(b) The protagonist would cherish and care for their new baby so that they could become experts in underwater basket weaving and astrophysics simultaneously.
3.target_answer: The protagonist would cherish and care for their new baby.

4.question:
I have a dog named lollipop. She is pregnant and nearly to gave birth. When the delivery time arrived,lollipop delivered four puppies. But one puppy is weak and unconscious. One puppy died and three were alive.
Which is more likely?
(a) The protagonist would rush the weak puppy to the vet for immediate medical attention.
(b) The protagonist would rush the weak puppy to the vet for immediate medical attention so that it could experience a thrilling adventure at the office.
4.target_answer: The protagonist would rush the weak puppy to the vet for immediate medical attention.
